summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Fourth Avenue Northeast and Hillman Place, each from East Green Lake Boulevard to East Sixty-fifth Street; East Sixty-fifth Street, from Latona Avenue to Weedin Place; Weedin Place, from East Seventieth Street to East Sixty-fifth Street; East Seventieth Street, from Woodlawn Avenue to Fifth Avenue Northwest; East Seventy-first Street and East Seventy-second Street, each from East Green Lake Boulevard to Fifth Avenue Northeast; East Seventy-third Street, from Maple Leaf Place to Fifth Avenue Northeast; Fifth Avenue Northeast, from east Seventieth Street to Maple Leaf Place, and Woodlawn Avenue, from Latona Avenue to Maple Leaf Place, all in the City of Seattle, by constructing concrete walks and wooden cross walks, together with all necessary appurtenances for the proper drainage, in accordance with Resolution No. 1264 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
